text: hi everyone today I'm cooking a very
simple vegetable soup that you can serve
as part of a Vietnamese family meal but
before that let's have a short visit to
a vegetable farm to learn a little bit
more about what kind of vegetables that
you can use for this soup it's really
nice to sometimes
escape from the bustling city to enjoy
the fresh air in the countryside like
this here you can find all kinds of
Vietnamese herbs and vegetables like
Basil's cilantro lettuce etc that's
where me working hard to go up the
ground there are many kinds of
vegetables that you can use to cook the
vegetable soup that we are cooking today
for example rosin dark or red spinach
like this one and you can also use the
normal green spinach too it contains a
lot of iron and is very good for you you
can also use water spinach or another
name is Morning Glory in Vietnamese we
call raw moon the stem is a pretty
crunchy and it's very tasty to route an
O or chrysanthemums is great to use for
this recipe too what I'm using today is
called rock I but there's also quite a
few types of rock guy the ones will
brightest them like this one is called
rocking up today I'm using rock I Chi
which is what I normally refer to as
mustard leaves so let's begin firstly
slide the beef against the grain into
very thin slices you can use beef
sirloin or filet mignon next season the
beef with pepper chicken stock and
minced garlic about 1/2 a TSP edge
also add 2 teaspoons of fish sauce and a
teaspoon of vegetable oil mix well and
set aside for about 15 minutes
next roughly pu and smash a small piece
of ginger ginger is the great flavor
enhancer guy but for other kaizo
vegetable soup you don't put ginger for
our guy you just cut into 2-inch lengths
then rinse a few times to get rid of all
the dust in a small pot heat a
tablespoon of vegetable oil and quickly
stir fry the beef just stir fry for a
minute just when the beef turns pale
immediately transfer back to the bowl
you don't want to overcook the beef
otherwise we'll be very chewy then add
water to the pot and bring to a boil you
can also use one part sugar and one part
chicken broth to make the soup more
hearty when it boys skim off the form
and season with one teaspoon of salt and
a teaspoon of chicken stock have a taste
and add a little bit more fish sauce if
needed then add the greens and bring the
soup to a boil again just when is about
to boy again at the stir-fried beef and
miss well
and don't forget to throw in the ginger
when it boys again immediately turn off
the heat that's it your soup is now
ready transfer to a serving bowl and
serve as part of a Vietnamese family
meal now lets me give it a try mmm the
soup is so clean and haughty the
vegetables is cooked just right and the
beef is so tender and juicy I love it
as much as I love the foods that you
cooked to photos and upload on Instagram
Facebook or Google+ click hashtag hand
and recipes it's such a great pleasure
to see Vietnamese food is getting more
and more popular and is loved by people
around the world thank you so much for
tagging me and please continue to do so
if you liked the video give us the good
thumbs up and subscribe to my channel
for more delicious Vietnamese food thank
you for watching bye bye
